00045 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00046  * @brief Deinitialize the PDMA peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00047  * @retval None
00048  ************************************************************************************************************/
00049 void PDMA_DeInit(void)
00050 {
00051   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00052 
00053   RSTCUReset.Bit.PDMA = 1;
00054   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00055 }
00056 
00057 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00058  * @brief Configure specific PDMA channel
00059  * @param PDMA_CHn: PDMA_CH0 ~ PDMA_CH5
00060  * @param PDMACH_InitStruct: pointer to a PDMACH_InitTypeDef structure.
00061  * @retval None
00062  ************************************************************************************************************/
00063 void PDMA_Config(u32 PDMA_CHn, PDMACH_InitTypeDef *PDMACH_InitStruct)
00064 {
00065   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *PDMACHx = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_CHn * 6 * 4);
00066 
00067   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00068   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CH(PDMA_CHn));
00069   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_WIDTH(PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_DataSize));
00070   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_PRIO(PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_Priority));
00071   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_ADR_MOD(PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_AdrMod));
00072   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_BLK_CNT(PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_BlkCnt));
00073   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_BLK_LEN(PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_BlkLen));
00074 
00075   /* PDMA channel x configuration                                                                           */
00076   PDMACHx->CR = (PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_DataSize | PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_Priority | PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_AdrMod);
00077 
00078   PDMACHx->SADR = PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_SrcAddr;
00079 
00080   PDMACHx->DADR = PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_DstAddr;
00081 
00082   PDMACHx->TSR = (PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_BlkCnt << 16) | PDMACH_InitStruct->PDMACH_BlkLen;
00083 }
00084 
00085 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00086  * @brief PDMA_AddrConfig
00087  * @param PDMA_CHn: PDMA_CH0 ~ PDMA_CH5
00088  * @param SrcAddr: Source address
00089  * @param DstAddr: Destination address
00090  * @retval None
00091  ************************************************************************************************************/
00092 void PDMA_AddrConfig(u32 PDMA_CHn, u32 SrcAddr, u32 DstAddr)
00093 {
00094   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *PDMACHx = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_CHn * 6 * 4);
00095 
00096   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00097   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CH(PDMA_CHn));
00098 
00099   /* transfer address configuration                                                                         */
00100   PDMACHx->SADR = SrcAddr;
00101   PDMACHx->DADR = DstAddr;
00102 }
00103

00105  * @brief PDMA_SrcAddrConfig
00106  * @param PDMA_CHn: PDMA_CH0 ~ PDMA_CH5
00107  * @param SrcAddr: Source address
00108  * @retval None
00109  ************************************************************************************************************/
00110 void PDMA_SrcAddrConfig(u32 PDMA_CHn, u32 SrcAddr)
00111 {
00112   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *PDMACHx = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_CHn * 6 * 4);
00113 
00114   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00115   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CH(PDMA_CHn));
00116 
00117   /* transfer address configuration                                                                         */
00118   PDMACHx->SADR = SrcAddr;
00119 }
00120 
00121 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00122  * @brief PDMA_DstAddrConfig

00127 void PDMA_DstAddrConfig(u32 PDMA_CHn, u32 DstAddr)
00128 {
00129   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *PDMACHx = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_CHn * 6 * 4);
00130 
00131   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00132   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CH(PDMA_CHn));
00133 
00134   /* transfer address configuration                                                                         */
00135   PDMACHx->DADR = DstAddr;
00136 }
00137 
00138 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00139  * @brief PDMA_TranSizeConfig
00140  * @param PDMA_CHn: PDMA_CH0 ~ PDMA_CH5
00141  * @param BlkCnt: Number of blocks for a transfer
00142  * @param BlkLen: Number of data for a block
00143  * @retval None
00144  ************************************************************************************************************/
00145 void PDMA_TranSizeConfig(u32 PDMA_CHn, u16 BlkCnt, u16 BlkLen)
00146 {
00147   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *PDMACHx = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_CHn * 6 * 4);
00148 
00149   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00150   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CH(PDMA_CHn));
00151   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_BLK_CNT(BlkCnt));
00152   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_BLK_LEN(BlkLen));
00153 
00154   /* transfer size configuration                                                                            */
00155   PDMACHx->TSR = ((BlkCnt << 16) | BlkLen);
00156 }
00157 
00158 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00159  * @brief Enable the specific PDMA channel interrupts
00160  * @param PDMA_CHn: PDMA_CH0 ~ PDMA_CH5
00161  * @param PDMA_INT_x: PDMA_INT_GE, PDMA_INT_BE, PDMA_INT_HT, PDMA_INT_TC, PDMA_INT_TE
00162  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00163  * @retval None
00164  ************************************************************************************************************/
00165 void PDMA_IntConfig(u32 PDMA_CHn, u32 PDMA_INT_x, ControlStatus NewState)
00166 {
00167   u32 uRegTmp = 0;
00168 
00169   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00170   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CH(PDMA_CHn));
00171   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_INT(PDMA_INT_x));
00172   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00173 
00174   #if (LIBCFG_PDMA_CH3FIX)
00175   if (PDMA_CHn == PDMA_CH3)
00176   {
00177     if (PDMA_INT_x & PDMA_INT_BE)
00178     {
00179       uRegTmp |= (PDMA_INT_BE << (PDMA_CH2 * 5));
00180     }
00181     if (PDMA_INT_x & PDMA_INT_HT)
00182     {
00183       uRegTmp |= (PDMA_INT_HT << (PDMA_CH2 * 5));
00184     }
00185   }
00186   #endif
00187 
00188   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00189   {
00190     HT_PDMA->IER |= ((PDMA_INT_x << (PDMA_CHn * 5)) | uRegTmp);
00191   }
00192   else
00193   {
00194     HT_PDMA->IER &= ~(PDMA_INT_x << (PDMA_CHn * 5));
00195   }
00196 }
00197 
00198 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00199  * @brief Enable a specific PDMA channel
00200  * @param PDMA_CHn: PDMA_CH0 ~ PDMA_CH5
00201  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00202  * @retval None
00203  ************************************************************************************************************/
00204 void PDMA_EnaCmd(u32 PDMA_CHn, ControlStatus NewState)
00205 {
00206   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *PDMACHx = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_CHn * 6 * 4);
00207 
00208   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00209   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CH(PDMA_CHn));
00210   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00211 
00212   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00213   {
00214     PDMACHx->CR |= (1UL);
00215   }
00216   else
00217   {
00218     PDMACHx->CR &= ~(1UL);
00219   }
00220 }
00221 
00222 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00223  * @brief Software trigger a specific PDMA channel
00224  * @param PDMA_CHn: PDMA_CH0 ~ PDMA_CH5
00225  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00226  * @retval None
00227  ************************************************************************************************************/
00228 void PDMA_SwTrigCmd(u32 PDMA_CHn, ControlStatus NewState)
00229 {
00230   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *PDMACHx = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_CHn * 6 * 4);
00231 
00232   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00233   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CH(PDMA_CHn));
00234   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00235 
00236   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00237   {
00238     PDMACHx->CR |= (1UL << 1);
00239   }
00240   else
00241   {
00242     PDMACHx->CR &= ~(1UL << 1);
00243   }
00244 }
00245 
00246 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00247  * @brief Get the specific PDMA channel interrupt flag
00248  * @param PDMA_CHn: PDMA_CH0 ~ PDMA_CH5
00249  * @param PDMA_FLAG_x: PDMA_FLAG_GE, PDMA_FLAG_BE, PDMA_FLAG_HT, PDMA_FLAG_TC, PDMA_FLAG_TE
00250  * @retval SET or RESET
00251  ************************************************************************************************************/
00252 FlagStatus PDMA_GetFlagStatus(u32 PDMA_CHn, u32 PDMA_FLAG_x)
00253 {
00254   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00255      Must turn on the PDMA IER to get the ISR flag.
00256      For example: PDMA_GetFlagStatus(PDMA_CH0, PDMA_INT_TC, ENABLE);
00257   */
00258   
00259   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00260   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CH(PDMA_CHn));
00261   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_FLAG(PDMA_FLAG_x));
00262 
00263   if (HT_PDMA->ISR & (PDMA_FLAG_x << PDMA_CHn * 5))
00264   {
00265     return SET;
00266   }
00267   else
00268   {
00269     return RESET;
00270   }
00271 }
00272 
00273 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00274  * @brief Clear the specific PDMA channel interrupt flags
00275  * @param PDMA_CHn: PDMA_CH0 ~ PDMA_CH5
00276  * @param PDMA_FLAG_x: PDMA_FLAG_GE, PDMA_FLAG_BE, PDMA_FLAG_HT, PDMA_FLAG_TC, PDMA_FLAG_TE
00277  * @retval None
00278  ************************************************************************************************************/
00279 void PDMA_ClearFlag(u32 PDMA_CHn, u32 PDMA_FLAG_x)
00280 {
00281   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00282   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CH(PDMA_CHn));
00283   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CLEAR_FLAG(PDMA_FLAG_x));
00284 
00285   HT_PDMA->ISCR |= (PDMA_FLAG_x << PDMA_CHn * 5);
00286 }
00287 
00288 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00289  * @brief Get remain block count of the specific PDMA channel
00290  * @retval CBLKCNT
00291  ************************************************************************************************************/
00292 u16 PDMA_GetRemainBlkCnt(u32 PDMA_CHn)
00293 {
00294   HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *PDMACHx = (HT_PDMACH_TypeDef *)(HT_PDMA_BASE + PDMA_CHn * 6 * 4);
00295 
00296   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00297   Assert_Param(IS_PDMA_CH(PDMA_CHn));
00298 
00299   return ((PDMACHx->CTSR) >> 16);
00300 }
